author: Staff Reporter
text:
A. Kathir, Executive Director of Evidence, said that the police initially hesitated to register a case but later registered without invoking the Bonded Labour System (Abolition) Act and the SC/ST Prevention of Authorities Act.

“Only under those acts, the boy will be eligible for compensation and rehabilitation. The guilty will also be punished severely,” he said.

A police official from Karimedu, however, said that appropriate sections had been invoked as per the complaint.

“The scene of crime is Mumbai. So, we will be transferring the case,” he said.

M.R. Vairamuthu Raju, GRH Dean, said that the decision was taken in consultation with boy’s family and after assessment of the wound.

“If they think more treatment is needed, we are happy to admit them again,” he said.
title: “Case was registered inappropriately ”
